adjectives.description: unfit (comparative unfitter or more unfit, superlative unfittest or most unfit)

entries.meaning: Not fit; not having the correct requirements.
examples: Jack cannot run, making him unfit for the track team.

entries.meaning: Not fit, not having a good physical demeanor.
examples: I've become so unfit after stopping cycling to town.

entries.meaning: (often with for) Unsuitable for a particular purpose.

verbs.description: unfit (third-person singular simple present unfits, present participle unfitting, simple past and past participle unfitted)

entries.meaning: To make unfit; to render unsuitable, spoil, disqualify.
examples: These preoccupations unfitted the soldiers for the defence of the frontier, and permitted vigorous incursions of Germans form the north and Persians from the east.
